channel.title: Auto-Cache Downloader
channel.description:
:palm:
if u know how to make an auto-cache for a 317 please add me on skype...raph.desgens1 i try alots of tut and it dont work or just help me on this! https://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,660140.msg4414050.html#msg4414050

item.title: Auto-Cache Downloader
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Assuming you want to do it as stated, use this to download the archive and this to decompress the zip file.

[hr]

I told you how to add this the correct way in your previous thread and will quote over my comment,

[quote=“Pure_, post:5, topic:541270”]This depends on your server, this should already be implemented in your client, just add the CRC checks server-sided and send the byte streams of the updated cache files as required.

I would recommend reading about the login block. Then continue with the JAGGRAB Protocol which is used to download the cache files from the file server. Finish off with the OnDemand Protocol which handles the file streaming from the server to client.

ps: Odds are your server has this implemented and you just need to toggle it, good luck.[/quote]

I will expand upon this a little. In the login block the client sends to the server nine cache version files, the server should then check it against the ones it has (as per the latest cache it has stored) then evaluate whether or not an update is required. If one is required then you will send over the data, as described in the wiki pages above.

ps Stop making new threads in hopes of somebody doing it all for you.

Read full topic
